titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress regarding the establishment of National Shaken Baby Syndrome Awareness Week.
Expressing the sense of Congress regarding the prevention of shaken baby syndrome.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Civil Service and Agency Organization.
Mr. Platts moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 59.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary: 4/3/2001--Passed House amended. Supports efforts to protect children from abuse and neglect. Encourages the people of the United States to educate themselves regarding shaken baby syndrome and the techniques to prevent it.
